Q.3: How can we make an class act as an interface in C++?
options: By only providing all the functions as virtual functions in the class.
Defining the class following with the keyword virtual
Defining the class following with the keyword interface
Defining the class following with the keyword abstract
answer: By only providing all the functions as virtual functions in the class.

Q.9: Which of the following statements is incorrect?
options: Variables having visibility may not have any scope.
Variables having scope may not be visible.
answer: Variables having visibility may not have any scope.
